bill_title: require that certain judgements awarded to certain offenders be used to provide restitution to crime victims.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain judgements awarded to certain offenders be used to provide restitution to crime victims. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any money that has been awarded as a judgement to any person who, whether as a juvenile or an adult, has been incarcerated in a jail, detention facility, or correctional facility shall be placed in trust for a period of five years if the award is based on mistreatment or abuse by officials employed at the jail or facility or by law enforcement officers or officials at any time before or during such incarceration. The money shall be used during the five-year period to provide restitution to victims of the person's offenses and may not be released to the person before the expiration of the five-year period. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
